text: Colorado's 26th Senate district is one of 35 districts in the Colorado Senate. It has been represented by Democrat Jeff Bridges since 2019, following the resignation of fellow Democrat Daniel Kagan. ==Geography== District 26 covers many of Denver's immediate southern suburbs in Arapahoe County, including Cherry Hills Village, Englewood, Greenwood Village, Sheridan, Columbine Valley, most of Littleton, and a small part of western Aurora. The district is split between Colorado's 1st and Colorado's 6th congressional district, and overlaps with the 3rd, 38th, 40th, and 41st districts of the Colorado House of Representatives. ==Recent election results== Colorado Senators are elected to staggered four-year terms; under normal circumstances, the 26th district holds elections in presidential years. ===2020=== ===2016=== ===2012=== ===Federal and statewide results in District 26=== {| class=wikitable |- ! width="30" | Year ! width="60" | Office ! width="180" | Results |- | 2018 | Governor | align="right" | Polis 58.5 – 38.2% |- | 2016 | President | align="right" | Clinton 54.1 – 37.1% |- | rowspan="2" | 2014 | Senate | align="right" | Udall 49.3 – 45.5% |- | Governor | align="right" | Hickenlooper 54.3 – 41.8% |- | 2012 | President | align="right" | Obama 53.4 – 44.3% |} == References == 26 Category:Arapahoe County, Colorado
title: Colorado's 26th Senate district
